intro: Cyclanthera achocchilla, commonly known as the Brazilian bitter melon, is a climbing vine native to South America. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes other cucurbits like cucumbers and squash. The plant produces small, bitter green fruits that are typically harvested when immature. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and trailing. Cyclanthera achocchilla is often grown for its edible fruits, though they are not as widely cultivated as other members of its family.
